content.question:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table with 2 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The heading for row 3 is “f prime of x.” The data are as follows. Column 1. x is 3. f of x is 4. f prime of x is one third. Column 2. x is 6. f of x is 5. f prime of x is three fourths." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="4em 0.05em 4em 4em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd><mtd></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.25ex" height="3.75ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
The table above gives selected values for a differentiable and increasing function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative. Let <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the increasing function given by <math alttext="g of x, equals, f of x, plus f of, open parenthesis, 2 x, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="g of 3, equals, f of 3, plus f of 6, which equals 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>f</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following describes a correct process for finding <math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 9, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator g prime of, open parenthesis, g inverse of 9, close parenthesis, end fraction, which equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator g prime of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of 3, equals, f prime of 3, plus 2 times f prime of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 9, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator g prime of, open parenthesis, g inverse of 9, close parenthesis, end fraction, which equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator g prime of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of 3, equals, f prime of 3, plus f prime of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 9, equals, g prime of, open parenthesis, g inverse of 9, close parenthesis, which equals, g prime of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of 3, equals, f prime of 3, plus f prime of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 9, equals, g prime of, open parenthesis, g inverse of 9, close parenthesis, which equals, g prime of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of 3, equals, f prime of 3, plus 2 times f prime of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, g inverse, close parenthesis, prime, of 9, equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator g prime of, open parenthesis, g inverse of 9, close parenthesis, end fraction, which equals, the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator g prime of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="g prime of 3, equals, f prime of 3, plus 2 times f prime of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
